Prep 10 m Ready In 10 m Place the tomatoes, onion, garlic, lime juice, salt, green chiles, and cilantro in a blender or food processor. Blend on low to desired consistency.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/828107.jpg

made it  |  17 reviews Recipe by: SpeedySanchez "Roasted-pepper green salsa just like grandma makes it, well, minus the molcajete. It's just easier to make in a food processor. The heat of your salsa can be controlled by the amount of seeds and membrane you leave in the pepper pods. " Featured in Allrecipes Magazine — Subscribe! Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

2 fresh poblano chile peppers ADVERTISEMENT 2 serrano chile peppers ADVERTISEMENT 6 fresh tomatillos, husks removed ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2-inch slice of white onion ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic ADVERTISEMENT salt to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro (optional) ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 10 m Ready In 30 m Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate. Lay the poblano peppers, serrano peppers, and tomatillos on the hot grill, and cook, turning every 2 minutes, until the pepper skins are evenly charred and blackened, and the tomatillos have turned pale yellow and started to ooze juice, about 10 minutes. Remove the vegetables from the grill. Scrape off most of the burned pepper skin, cut the stems off, cut the peppers in half the long way, and remove the seeds. Place the onion and garlic in the work bowl of a food processor, and pulse about 4 times to chop. Drop in the peppers, pulse 4 times to roughly chop, and add the tomatillos and salt. Pulse 4 or more times to the desired smoothness, and stir in the cilantro.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/3888455.jpg

made it  |  49 reviews Recipe by: RNCOGGINS "The delicious taste of scallops is perfectly complemented by a wonderful fresh fruit salsa in this quick but elegant dish. Be sure to use large, plump sea scallops rather than smaller bay scallops and take care not to overcook the scallops; they should remain tender and moist. Feel free to substitute any of your favorite exotic fruits for the pineapple and mango in the salsa." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1/2 cup diced fresh pineapple ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup diced fresh mango ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup peeled and diced cucumber ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro ADVERTISEMENT 4 teaspoons fresh lime juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound sea scallops, rinsed and drained ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 5 m Ready In 20 m Combine the pineapple, mango, cucumber, bell pepper, bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice and jalapeno. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and set aside. Heat a large, nonstick fry pan over medium-high heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray. Season the scallops with salt and pepper. Add half of the scallops to the pan; sear until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer the scallops to a warmed plate; set aside. Repeat with the remaining scallops. Divide the scallops among four warmed plates. Spoon the salsa over the scallops, and serve immediately.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/66199.jpg

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion, and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Mix rice into skillet, stirring often. When rice begins to brown, stir in chicken broth and salsa. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 20 minutes, until liquid has been absorbed.

2 cups red lentils ADVERTISEMENT 1 large onion, diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons curry paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon curry powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 30 m Ready In 40 m Wash the lentils in cold water until the water runs clear. Put lentils in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil, place a cover on the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, adding water during cooking as needed to keep covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions in hot oil until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Mix curry paste, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, salt, sugar, garlic, and ginger together in a large bowl; stir into the onions. Increase heat to high and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato puree, remove from heat and stir into the lentils.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/3264007.jpg

6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup prepared mustard ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon paprika ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 45 m Ready In 1 h Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and pepper to taste, and place in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the honey, mustard, basil, paprika, and parsley. Mix well. Pour 1/2 of this mixture over the chicken, and brush to cover. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Turn chicken pieces over and brush with the remaining 1/2 of the honey mustard mixture. Bake for an additional 10 to 15 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1052895.jpg

made it  |  1949 reviews Recipe by: FOODGU1 "Don't let some of the ingredients fool you--this spicy shrimp makes a simple, impressive dish, which I usually make for company. For more or less heat, adjust amount of red pepper. Serve over hot steamed rice." Featured in Allrecipes Magazine — Subscribe! Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

4 tablespoons water ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons ketchup ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons cornstarch ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup sliced green onions ADVERTISEMENT 4 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 12 ounces cooked shrimp, tails removed ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m In a bowl, stir together water, ketchup, soy sauce, cornstarch, honey, crushed red pepper, and ground ginger. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in green onions and garlic; cook 30 seconds. Stir in shrimp, and toss to coat with oil. Stir in sauce. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbly and thickened.

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon baking soda ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT 2 egg whites ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup banana, mashed ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup applesauce ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 55 m Ready In 1 h 5 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x4 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Add egg whites, bananas and applesauce; stir just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 55 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean. Turn out onto wire rack and allow to cool before slicing.

1 pound lean ground beef ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 3 (15 ounce) cans dark red kidney beans ADVERTISEMENT 3 (14.5 ounce) cans Mexican-style stewed tomatoes ADVERTISEMENT 2 stalks celery, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 red bell pepper, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup red wine vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried parsley ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 dash Worcestershire sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup red wine ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 6 h 10 m Ready In 6 h 20 m In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook ground beef until evenly browned. Drain off grease, and season to taste with salt and pepper. In a slow cooker, combine the cooked beef, kidney beans, tomatoes, celery, red bell pepper, and red wine vinegar. Season with chili powder, cumin, parsley, basil and Worcestershire sauce. Stir to distribute ingredients evenly. Cook on High for 6 hours, or on Low for 8 hours. Pour in the wine during the last 2 hours.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/249686.jpg

2 tablespoons olive oil, divided ADVERTISEMENT 1 large yam, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1 large parsnip, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup baby carrots ADVERTISEMENT 1 zucchini, cut into 1 inch slices ADVERTISEMENT 1 bunch fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup roasted red peppers, cut into 1-inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 1 h Ready In 1 h 55 m Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Place the yams, parsnips, and carrots onto the baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, then add the zucchini and asparagus, and drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Continue baking until all of the vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes more. Once tender, remove from the oven, and allow to cool for 30 minutes on the baking sheet. Toss the roasted peppers together with the garlic, basil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until combined. Add the roasted vegetables, and toss to mix. Serve at room temperature or cold.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/46633.jpg

2 1/4 cups dried split peas ADVERTISEMENT 2 quarts cold water ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 pounds ham bone ADVERTISEMENT 2 onions, thinly sliced ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch dried marjoram ADVERTISEMENT 3 stalks celery, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 3 carrots, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 potato, diced ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 2 h Ready In 10 h 30 m In a large stock pot, cover peas with 2 quarts cold water and soak overnight. If you need a faster method, simmer the peas gently for 2 minutes, and then soak for l hour. Once peas are soaked, add ham bone, onion, salt, pepper and marjoram. Cover, bring to boil and then simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove bone; cut off meat, dice and return meat to soup. Add celery, carrots and potatoes. Cook slowly, uncovered for 30 to 40 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/576102.jpg

2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C) ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 3 1/3 cups all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 20 m Ready In 1 h 50 m In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast and brown sugar in the water, and let sit for 10 minutes. Stir the salt and oil into the yeast solution. Mix in 2 1/2 cups of the flour. Turn dough out onto a clean, well floured surface, and knead in more flour until the dough is no longer sticky. Place the dough into a well oiled bowl, and cover with a cloth. Let the dough rise until double; this should take about 1 hour. Punch down the dough, and form a tight ball. Allow the dough to relax for a minute before rolling out. Use for your favorite pizza recipe. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). If you are baking the dough on a pizza stone, you may place your toppings on the dough, and bake immediately. If you are baking your pizza in a pan, lightly oil the pan, and let the dough rise for 15 or 20 minutes before topping and baking it. Bake pizza in preheated oven, until the cheese and crust are golden brown, about 15 to 20 minutes.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/690435.jpg

made it  |  743 reviews Recipe by: ALANASMOM "This is an excellent authentic Mexican rice recipe (not to be confused with Spanish rice) that I make as a side dish with all of my Mexican dishes. Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet. Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat for 5 minutes until it is smoking hot. Mix together the paprika, salt, cayenne, cumin, thyme, white pepper, and onion powder. Oil the chicken breasts with cooking spray on both sides, then coat the chicken breasts evenly with the spice mixture. Place the chicken in the hot pan, and cook for 1 minute. Turn, and cook 1 minute on other side. Place the breasts on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes.

1 (2 pound) pork tenderloin ADVERTISEMENT 1 (1 ounce) envelope dry onion soup mix ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup red wine ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT freshly ground black pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 4 h Ready In 4 h 15 m Place pork tenderloin in a slow cooker with the contents of the soup packet. Pour water, wine, and soy sauce over the top, turning the pork to coat. Carefully spread garlic over the pork, leaving as much on top of the roast during cooking as possible. Sprinkle with pepper, cover, and cook on low setting for 4 hours. Serve with cooking liquid on the side as au jus.

1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 green bell pepper, cut into 2 inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 onion, cut into wedges ADVERTISEMENT 3 cloves garlic, peeled ADVERTISEMENT 1 egg ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon Thai chili sauce or hot sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 20 m Ready In 35 m If grilling, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil a sheet of aluminum foil. If baking, preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and lightly oil a baking sheet. In a medium bowl, mash black beans with a fork until thick and pasty. In a food processor, finely chop bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Then stir into mashed beans. In a small bowl, stir together egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce. Stir the egg mixture into the mashed beans. Mix in bread crumbs until the mixture is sticky and holds together. Divide mixture into four patties. If grilling, place patties on foil, and grill about 8 minutes on each side. If baking, place patties on baking sheet, and bake about 10 minutes on each side.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/25840.jpg

1 onion, peeled and halved ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups dry pinto beans, rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 5 teaspoons salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 3/4 teaspoons fresh ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon ground cumin, optional ADVERTISEMENT 9 cups water ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 8 h Ready In 8 h 15 m Place the onion, rinsed beans, jalapeno, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin into a slow cooker. Pour in the water and stir to combine. Cook on High for 8 hours, adding more water as needed. Note: if more than 1 cup of water has evaporated during cooking, then the temperature is too high. Once the beans have cooked, strain them, and reserve the liquid. Mash the beans with a potato masher, adding the reserved water as needed to attain desired consistency.

Prep 20 m Cook 12 m Ready In 5 h In a medium bowl, mix together cocoa, white sugar, and vegetable oil. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into the cocoa mixture. Cover dough, and chill for at least 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line cookie sheets with parchment paper. Roll dough into one inch balls. I like to use a number 50 size scoop. Coat each ball in confectioners' sugar before placing onto prepared cookie sheets. 1 cup pineapple juice ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup packed brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup light soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 pounds chicken breast tenderloins or strips ADVERTISEMENT skewers ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 10 m Ready In 1 h 10 m In a small saucepan over medium heat, mix pineapple juice, brown sugar, and soy sauce. Remove from heat just before the mixture comes to a boil. Place chicken tenders in a medium bowl. Cover with the pineapple marinade, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat grill for medium heat. Thread chicken lengthwise onto wooden skewers. Lightly oil the grill grate. Grill chicken tenders 5 minutes per side, or until juices run clear. They cook quickly, so watch them closely.
